description:
This protocol provides a method to study phage-bacteria interactions by generating a Network in Cytoscape using the application CoNet. To CoNet tutorial can help with analysis. Based on the methods from the following publication:

Hannigan, Geoffrey D., et al. "The Human Skin Double-Stranded DNA Virome: Topographical and Temporal Diversity, Genetic Enrichment, and Dynamic Associations with the Host Microbiome." mBio 6.5 (2015): e01578-15.
before_start:
Perl scripts and other supplementary information is available at:

https://figshare.com/articles/The_Human_Skin_dsDNA_Virome_Topographical_and_Temporal_Diversity_Genetic_Enrichment_and_Dynamic_Associations_with_the_Host_Microbiome/1281248
protocol_affiliation: DEPARTMENT OF DERMATOLOGY UNIVERSITY OF PENNSYLVANIA

guidelines:
Required Software
  • Cytoscape v3.1.1
  • CoNet

Relevent Files
Output:
  • CoNet/skinmet_metaphlan_merged_output_genera.txt
  • CoNet/taxonomy_species_rel_abund_table.tsv
  • CoNet/org_skinmet_for_conet.txt
  • CoNet/org_phage_for_conet.txt
  • CoNet/org_perm.txt
  • CoNet/org_boot.txt
R script: R15

components.data: First format input tables for downstream analysis. The phage relative abundance table is generated from the UniProt species level taxonomic classifications.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: First format input tables for downstream analysis. The phage relative abundance table is generated from the UniProt species level taxonomic classifications.

components.data: Match each sample taxonomy rel abund list to corresponding master list.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Match each sample taxonomy rel abund list to corresponding master list.

source_data.name:
mkdir ./uniprot_taxonomy_format_for_conet/samples_mapped_to_master_list_species
for file in $(ls ./uniprot_contig_virome_trembl_rel_abund/trembl_species_rel_abund | grep 'rel'); do
	awk 'FNR==NR {a[$1]=$2;next}{ print $1"\t"a[$1] }' ./uniprot_contig_virome_trembl_rel_abund/trembl_species_rel_abund/${file} ./uniprot_taxonomy_format_for_conet/trembl_species_master_list.tsv | sed "1 s/^/Taxa_ID\t${file}\n/" | cut -f 2 | sed 's/rel_abund_//' | sed 's/_R1\.txt//' > ./uniprot_taxonomy_format_for_conet/samples_mapped_to_master_list_species/${file}
done

components.data: Add title to top of master list.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add title to top of master list.

components.data: Paste together the relative abundance information files with the master taxonomy list.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Paste together the relative abundance information files with the master taxonomy list.

components.data: The output file, taxonomy_species_rel_abund_table.tsv contains all viral classifications. Since we are only interested in the phage, we ran the following commands:
components.name: Description

source_data.description: The output file, taxonomy_species_rel_abund_table.tsv contains all viral classifications. Since we are only interested in the phage, we ran the following commands:

source_data.name:
head -n 1 taxonomy_species_rel_abund_table.tsv >> phage_species.txt
grep "phage"  taxonomy_species_rel_abund_table.tsv >> phage_species.txt
grep "Phage" taxonomy_species_rel_abund_table.tsv >> phage_species.txt

components.data: The file phage_species.txt contains counts, not relative abundances. For the metagenome samples, we are going to use the general level relative abundances generated by MetaPhlAn. But first, we are going to fix the header from the MetaPhlAn output:
components.name: Description

source_data.description: The file phage_species.txt contains counts, not relative abundances. For the metagenome samples, we are going to use the general level relative abundances generated by MetaPhlAn. But first, we are going to fix the header from the MetaPhlAn output:

components.data: Now we are going to use the script R13 to organize the input files so that the columns of the virome and microbiome file match (i.e. the Ra sample from Subject 1 at visit 2 is the same column number for both the virome and metagenome files).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Now we are going to use the script R13 to organize the input files so that the columns of the virome and microbiome file match (i.e. the Ra sample from Subject 1 at visit 2 is the same column number for both the virome and metagenome files).

components.data: Additionally, we are going to convert the counts in phage_species.txt to relative abundance of the phages. This R script generates the files org_phage_for_conet.txt and org_skinmet_for_conet.txt.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Additionally, we are going to convert the counts in phage_species.txt to relative abundance of the phages. This R script generates the files org_phage_for_conet.txt and org_skinmet_for_conet.txt.

components.data: In Cytoscape, we opened CoNet and then in the "Data" menu we loaded the org_skinmet_for_conet.txt and org_phage_for_conet.txt and followed the CoNet tutorials.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: In Cytoscape, we opened CoNet and then in the "Data" menu we loaded the org_skinmet_for_conet.txt and org_phage_for_conet.txt and followed the CoNet tutorials.

components.data: Following the matrix infor recommendation, we opened the "Preprocessing and filter menu" and selected row_minocc, setting it to 84. We also checked the box that says "Keep sum of filtered rows"
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Following the matrix infor recommendation, we opened the "Preprocessing and filter menu" and selected row_minocc, setting it to 84. We also checked the box that says "Keep sum of filtered rows"

components.data: To perform permutations, in the "Methods menu", we checked the "Pearson", "Spearman", "Mutual information", "Bray Curtis" and "Kullback Leibler" boxes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: To perform permutations, in the "Methods menu", we checked the "Pearson", "Spearman", "Mutual information", "Bray Curtis" and "Kullback Leibler" boxes.

components.data: We selected the "Automatic threshold setting" button, selected "edgeNumber", entered 250 for the edge selection parameter and enabled "Top and bottom".
components.name: Description

source_data.description: We selected the "Automatic threshold setting" button, selected "edgeNumber", entered 250 for the edge selection parameter and enabled "Top and bottom".

components.data: In the "Randomization menu" under "Randomization routine", we selected "edgeScores" as the routine and "shuffle_rows" as the resampling method.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: In the "Randomization menu" under "Randomization routine", we selected "edgeScores" as the routine and "shuffle_rows" as the resampling method.

components.data: Under "Randomization options", we checked the "Renormalize (edgeScores routine only)" box.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Under "Randomization options", we checked the "Renormalize (edgeScores routine only)" box.

components.data: Under "Save" we saved the output file as "org_perm.txt"
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Under "Save" we saved the output file as "org_perm.txt"

components.data: We ran the permutations and removed the intermediate network from Cytoscape.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: We ran the permutations and removed the intermediate network from Cytoscape.

components.data: To perform bootstraps in the "Methods menu", we removed the 250 edge selection parameter.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: To perform bootstraps in the "Methods menu", we removed the 250 edge selection parameter.

components.data: In the "Randomization menu" we disabled "Renormalize (edgeScores routine only)" , we changed the resampling method to "bootstrap" we selected "benjaminihochber" multiple test correction with a p value threshold of 0.05. Under "Load null distributions", we selected "org_perm.txt", we selected "sime" as the p-value merge options, and we saved the new output file as "org_boot.txt".
components.name: Description

source_data.description: In the "Randomization menu" we disabled "Renormalize (edgeScores routine only)" , we changed the resampling method to "bootstrap" we selected "benjaminihochber" multiple test correction with a p value threshold of 0.05. Under "Load null distributions", we selected "org_perm.txt", we selected "sime" as the p-value merge options, and we saved the new output file as "org_boot.txt".

components.data: In Cytoscape, under Layout, we selected Edge-weighted Spring Embedded-pval-simes-merge. Under the "Style" section of the control panel, we changed the node color to reflect taxon type (blue for bacteria and yellow for phage) and relative abundance (the darker the color, the more abundant the taxon).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: In Cytoscape, under Layout, we selected Edge-weighted Spring Embedded-pval-simes-merge. Under the "Style" section of the control panel, we changed the node color to reflect taxon type (blue for bacteria and yellow for phage) and relative abundance (the darker the color, the more abundant the taxon).

components.data: To visualize network properties, in the Cytoscape toolbar, we selected "Tools"->"NetworkAnalyzer"->"Network Analysis" and treated the network as undirected.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: To visualize network properties, in the Cytoscape toolbar, we selected "Tools"->"NetworkAnalyzer"->"Network Analysis" and treated the network as undirected.

components.data: The network has 21 nodes and a heterogeneity score of 0.819. In the results panel, we observed the Node Degree distribution and fit a power-law to it. The characteristic path length for the network was 2.781.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: The network has 21 nodes and a heterogeneity score of 0.819. In the results panel, we observed the Node Degree distribution and fit a power-law to it. The characteristic path length for the network was 2.781.
